glsa.title: Xvid: Array indexing vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Several array indexing vulnerabilities were discovered in Xvid, possibly allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Xvid is a popular open source video codec licensed under the GPL.

description.p: Trixter Jack discovered an array indexing error in the get_intra_block() function in the file src/bitstream/mbcoding.c. The get_inter_block_h263() and get_inter_block_mpeg() functions in the same file were also reported as vulnerable.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code by tricking a user or automated system into processing a malicious video file with an application that makes use of the Xvid library.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
